{{Infobox Network Adapter |image1 = |image1_size = |caption = Wireless AC1000 Dual Band USB Adapter |caption2 = |pp = http://www.dlink.com/us/en/home-solutions/connect/adapters/dwa-180-wireless-ac1000-dual-band-usb-adapter |sp = http://support.dlink.com/ProductInfo.aspx?m=DWA-180 |dl = http://ftp.dlink.ru/pub/Wireless/DWA-180/ |wikidevi = |wikipedia = |brand = D-Link |model = DWA-180 |submodelappend = |submodel = |revision = A1 |subrevision = |model_part_num = |page_start_date = 04/12/2013 |page_start_origon = https://wikidevi.com/wiki/D-Link_DWA-180_rev_A1 |sernum = |wlclass = AC1000 |series = |if = USB |if_bus_version = 2.0 |ifconnector = Male A |formfactor = dongle |vendor_id = 2001 |device_id = 3316 |subvendor_id = |subdevice_id = |id_string = |windosid = |fcc_id = KA2WA180A1 |icid = 4216A-WA180A1 |boardid = |ecc_id = |oui = |ethoui = |chip1 = Realtek;RTL8812AU; |chip2 = |chip3 = |chip4 = |antconn = |antenna = |txchains = 2 |rxchains = 2 |sstreams = 2 |wirelessstand = IEEE 802.11a/b/g/n/ac |acqam = |802.11ac = 650 |nqam = |802.11n = 300/300 |802.11g = 54 |802.11b = 11 |802.11a = 54 |wififreq = 2.4 or 5 |receive_sens = |transmit_power = |linuxdriv = |windriv = |is_manuf = No |manuf = Cameo |manuf_model = |manuf_rev = |addchip = |flags = |802dot11_protocols = abgn+ac |accessible_UART = No |accessible_JTAG = |category = |availability = |eoldate = |fccapprovdate = 04/24/2013 |estreldate = 04/29/2013 |estprice = |upc = 790069391248 |ean = |dx_sku = |newegg = 9SIA4RE4S36537 |asin = B00CL58IJC |asin_country = |asin2 = |asin_country2 = |countrymanuf = China |powledcolor = |connactled = |spdledcolor = |leddupcolor = |dimmin = |weight = }}{{TIDTOC|adapter}} ==Overview== *{{WiFiCert|WFA19269|04/02/2013}} '''[[D-Link]]''''s product page indicates that this device :has a USB 2.0 interface. Despite that, it is clearly shown with a USB 3.0 jack :(also w/ '''blue''' color) in the FCC photos. It's marketed as an '''AC1000''' device.. which appears to be :650Mbps capable (5GHz) and 300Mbps (2.4GHz). The FCC test report indicates that this device will be used :for a DWA-182 revision (rev. B1 / Bx?). It is also notes that the devices are electrically identical. ==Drivers== There is a USB ID (2001:330e) for an RTL8812AU device named :as DWA-183 found in the driver set for [[Edimax EW-7822UAC]]. A later driver set (1023.5.0116.2013, for [[Elecom WDC-867U3]]) :has two '''D-Link''' RTL8812AU USB IDs... :• DWA-182 rev B1: 2001:3313 :• DWA-183 rev A1: 2001:330e *[https://github.com/abperiasamy/rtl8812AU_8821AU_linux/blob/9f09c7627bda0ab5a577c1ad0337666ca2951132/os_dep/linux/usb_intf.c ''abperiasamy/rtl8812AU_8821AU_linux'' driver on '''GitHub'''] 
{USB_DEVICE(0x2001, 0x330e), RTL8812}, /* D-Link DWA-183 rev A1 - Alpha */
{USB_DEVICE(0x2001, 0x330f), RTL8188}, /* D-Link DWA-125 rev D1 */
{USB_DEVICE(0x2001, 0x3310), RTL8188}, /* D-Link DWA-123 rev D1 */
{USB_DEVICE(0x2001, 0x3311), RTL8188}, /* D-Link GO-USB-N150 rev B1 */
{USB_DEVICE(0x2001, 0x3313), RTL8812}, /* D-Link DWA-182 rev B1 - Alpha */
{USB_DEVICE(0x2001, 0x3314), RTL8821}, /* D-Link DWA-171 rev A1 - Cameo */
{USB_DEVICE(0x2001, 0x3315), RTL8812}, /* D-Link DWA-182 rev C1 - Cameo */
{USB_DEVICE(0x2001, 0x3316), RTL8812}, /* D-Link DWA-180 rev A1 - Cameo */
{USB_DEVICE(0x2001, 0x3318), RTL8821}, /* D-Link DWA-172 rev A1 - Cameo *
{USB_DEVICE(0x2001, 0x331a), RTL8814A}, /* D-Link DWA-192 rev A1 - Alpha */
{USB_DEVICE(0x2001, 0x331c), RTL8822B}, /* D-Link DWA-182 rev D1 - */
==Links of Interest== [http://ftp.dlink.ru/pub/Wireless/DWA-180/Data_sh/DWA-180_A1_Datasheet_01%28HQ%29.pdf Datasheet] ==See also== *D-Link DWA-180 rev A1 *[[D-Link DWA-182 rev A1]] *[[D-Link DWA-182 rev B1]] *[[D-Link DWA-182 rev C1]] *[[D-Link DWA-182 rev D1]] *[[D-Link DWA-183 rev A1]] [[Category:English Documentation]]
